meanings.definition: To march or force someone to move forward by holding their arms from behind.
meanings.sent1: The police officer had to frogmarch the criminal out of the building.
meanings.sent2: The security guard had to frogmarch the troublemaker out of the mall.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to frogmarch the mischievous student to the principal's office.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind seemed to frogmarch the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The determined coach frogmarched the team to victory with intense training sessions.

meanings.definition: To move someone forcibly or roughly.
meanings.sent1: The bullies tried to frogmarch the smaller kid down the street.
meanings.sent2: The protesters attempted to frogmarch the politician out of the building.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully frogmarched each other around the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The floodwaters seemed to frogmarch everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The strong currents frogmarched the boat downstream despite the efforts of the sailors.
